reviews.sentence: Good value and location but not perfect. A nautical themed refurbished hotel with some less than stellar finishes but adequate comfort good beds great location on the water close to downtown with plenty to eat and helpful staff. There are some noticeable signs of poor craftsmanship. Drop ceiling is outdated and dirty. Painting is poorly done. Toilet barely worked. Shower was old school. Carpets need cleaning. Vending machine was out of order. Area has a lot of restaurants and a movie theater within steps of the hotel. Yet there are few shops and lots of vacant storefronts. Area is semi industrial and can be sketchy. I would enjoyed my stay for business. would not be my choice with the family.

Great location and views. Had a corner suite with beautiful views of the bay and port. Nice size room. Very comfortable bed. Have stayed many places in and around Oakland including the Claremont and with all that is available at Jack London Square we now prefer the Waterfront. Hallways could be updated.

Anniversary. It was beautiful to stay in a room overlooking the water. We stayed for Anniversary and would also like to take our family next time. There are a variety of activities shops and entertainment for all ages even you pets.

Room Charges. Everyhting was gret until checkout. apparently they do nt check ID when charging items to your room. There were 1200 in restaurant charges. one being a whopping 836 for one dinner. They did refund me right away as the staff at the front desk were amazing but I think their protocol needs a little refining.

Great balcony room with view of marina. Love this hotel because of its setting. Only hotel right on the water in the middle of Jack London Square. Prefer the balcony rooms on the marina with a sitting area. Beds are comfortable. Has Keurig coffee maker and provides 2 complimentary bottles of water. Restaurant and bar is good. Excellent specialty drinks in bar. Great fun to just relax on the restaurants outdoor patio and watch festivities in the area. Lots of events scheduled for this summer 2015 street dancing USS Potomac cruises farmers market wine expo and more. The landing for the Golden Gate Ferry is right next door. Can easily walk to Yoshis. fun and well known Japanese restaurant with small jazz theater. Cons do not get street side rooms because of a nearby rail track although the hotel provides all rooms with earplugs the valet parking is a whopping 25.

A lovely stay by the Bay. After reading the reviews of this place regarding train noise in particular I was not sure what I had find. But I decided to take the plunge. I am so glad I did. there is little action around Jack London Square anymore but the marina view is as fine as ever. For location it is hard to beat because in addition to being right next to the water they are a block from Yoshis and right next to the San Francisco Ferry. The hotel staff is fantastic and could not have been more helpful. I was here for one night following a tough week at work and this was a really good landing spot for me. I was on the third floor facing toward what I think is maybe southwest away from the view of the San Francisco skyline in the distance. Yes I could hear some trains but it was not problematic. I had a huge room with a separate living dining room with a fireplace for atmosphere. I had return in a heartbeat. Thanks Waterfront. I needed this.

Entertaining Place to Stay. Jack London Square is pretty lively with restaurants a historic landmark a farmers market craft fair on Saturday and the harbor outside your door. The ferry to SF is also nearby. The property is in good condition although the hallways could use some updating. The service and the views are nice. Valet parking is about 25 day. No grocery stores nearby but there is a BevMo. The room has a microwave and nice robes. It is not easy to get to the rest of Oakland from this location I had say a car is highly desirable.

Great Service great location. I blocked out a set of rooms here for my out of town wedding guests to stay at and it was perfect. The service was excellent always there to help with all the stuff we had to get up to the room and even helped organize a shuttle to get guests to the wedding. All of our guests were thoroughly charmed both by the hotel and by Jack London Square. We stayed in a suite which was huge perfect for all the pre wedding preping. The hotel itself is very stylish and has great views. My photographer was in love with the decor and did a bunch of bridesmaid pictures while we were still in the room and then we did the group family pictures around the hotel before heading over to the venue. I highly recommend this hotel if you are coming to Oakland.
it is always great to stay at the Waterfront Hotel. The staff is friendly and the rooms are a decent size with great views of the waterfront. Weekday wine and snacks are a perfect way to unwind.

A great place to stay in Oakland. we have had staycations here and found it comfortable and quiet. it is a good spot to enjoy the attractions of Jack London Square wine tasting outdoor performances Yoshis and Sunday Farmers Market. Try to get a room with a view.

Loved it. Great location to the ferry as well as many great restaurants. Will defiantly stay again. Was grandted early check in as well as late check out. Also paid for city view but received a water front view. Wish I could have stayed longer. One night just was not enough.

Wo nt be back. Room was not ready at 430pm so the wife and I had to change our clothes in the lobby bathroom prior to our night out on the town. The room we had was fairly large with a separate living area with views of the harbor but running the AC in the room lead to a leak in the ceiling near the door. Called the front desk and they had someone come up and look at it. They offered to change our rooms but all the rooms they had left would be a down grade. We decided to stay in the room and soon found out that the bed sheets and pillows were the absolute worst. It was an overall terrible experience and we will not be staying here again.

Wo nt be back. Room was not ready at 430 pm. Bedding and pillows were terribly uncomfortable. And we had a leak in the ceiling due to the AC unit. Nothing they could do about it at 10 pm unles we were willing to down grade our room. The room we had was of decent size with a view of harbor.

Stand Up Paddle Board. Bring your SUP or Paddle Board and be prepared to walk along the Bay toward the rowing team facilities lots of restaurants near by even managed to watch the Lindy Hoppers dancers at the Veterans Building on Lake Merit. Lots of History and the Ferry Bay Boat is right out your backdoor.

Worked Out Well. My husband and I booked a room mid week to see a show at Yoshis. we are from the Bay Area but did not want to do the long drive late evening after the show. I booked a room through hotelscom and was really happy with the room. There are 2 buildings and we were in the building next to the one with the hotel lobby. The room was generous in size with 2 queen beds and a little balcony looking out onto the street. The room was very quiet. It was nicely appointed with a large desk dresser unit. Plus it had a round table with 2 comfortable chairs as well as an easy chair next to the balcony. It was really comfortable for us to read in and use our devices. The wifi was terrific. I wish all accommodations had wifi that was this good. There is a Keurig cofemaker in the room which I find to be so civilized. There were only 2 coffee pods for the morning so I requested more at the front desk. They were very accommodating and Housekeeping dropped off additional ones. One drawback is that parking is valet parking and costs 30 per day. A second drawback is that there is no breakfast included in the rate. There is a small cafe by the hotel restaurant that offers coffee and some breakfast fare which we did not try. Everything worked well for our stay here and we would definitely stay here again. We met our cousins who live in Oakland for lunch at the hotel restaurant called Lungomare before leaving for home. The lunch was very good.

night stay. Everyone was very helpful and answered all questions. I t was a overnight stay so do not expect to much. I have stayed with you many times in the passed. I have a big weekend planed very soon and have some friends that will that will be staying also.

Meh nothing special about this place. The hotel put me in the wrong room — I had thought I had reserved a room with a balcony — and when I called the front desk they said they had put me in the correct room. I was exhausted so I did not push it. Next morning I looked up my hotelcom reservation and I had reserved a balcony room. After some initial pushback they decided to give me a small credit. The room had a strong electronic buzz and the air conditioning switched on and off VERY LOUDLY all night. Also the electrical plugs near the bed do not accommodate the iPhone power block see photos and there is only one outlet near the table area unles you unplug the Keurig.

Needs a Reno. The hotel is in need of a renovation. Jack Square is a nice little area but the surrounding area is very unsafe. Great location as it is right beside the ferry to San Francisco as you want to get out of Oakland.

I stayed in a 1King bed suite with a sea view from August 9 12 2019. It was something I wanted to visit for many years had to wait till I retired. The Waterfront Hotel is a seafaring themed hotel hesitate to say nautical themed. Each room or suite is quite large as large as a medium sized studio. I opted for the sea view which encompasses not only Jack London Square it ’s located in the middle of it just a few feet from the sculpture of the famous author but the ocean Alameda distant San Francisco. On Friday early evening to the weekends the sea view allows you to take in the three day festivities festooned with tents shops street food American Creole Soul dancers music the energy of people. The rooms are equipped with the standard fare but there is a nice dorm room sized refrigerator hidden in the cabinet beneath the large screen TV37 ” or larger. Next to it is your safe large enough for laptops other items. Below the safe is a 4dreser drawer ensemble. Two bottles of Kala Springs water is delivered daily. The bed is comfortable but I lounged watching TV on the large sofa as well. A circular dining table is positioned by the windows which can be opened enough to lean out taking in the nice sea breeze the aromas of a pizzeria just across the walkway the foods being prepared enjoyed outdoors from the hotel ’s Lungomare Restaurant Tuscan style Scott ’s Seafood Kincaid ’s Fish Chophouse restaurants the latter two walking distance. The room ’s bathroom is unique the bathtub shower is molded one piece with shelves a sturdy bar to hold onto. That part is built like the bunks from the seafaring days of the 170 180s. The shower head is adjustable from pinpoint to spray to both. There is a large desk with a curved back chair straddling four magazines introducing the guest to the sights sounds cuisines culture of Oakland. In room dining is from the Lungomare Restaurant a Tuscan cuisine of whose culinary dishes are lovingly handmade. I had a wonderful hand tossed pizza all pizzas are medium14 ”. accompanied by a prosciutto plate. If you ’re lucky to be in the east or Spinnaker Tower your elevators 2 drops you into a corridor leading to the restaurant. Note that the restaurant is packed reservations are recommended. Sunday Brunch encompasses the usual culinary fare. I had a Bolognese pasta with veal pork beef accompanied by nicely marinated vegetables. Dessert is either a Budino gelato or sorbet. There ’s an extensive wine list a selection of beers. The staff is knowledgeable especially for allergies they try to accommodate everyone. I gave it 4stars only because 15blocks away a rail line shared by Amtrak Caltrain freight shares rumbles around. This is a must visit hotel where the professional knowledgeable staff will accommodate you. It ’s part of the Joie de Vivre chain which is now part of the Hyat portfolio group of hotels.

This is a must visit hotel where the professional knowledgeable staff will accommodate you. It ’s part of the Joie de Vivre chain which is now part of the Hyat portfolio group of hotels.

Girls trip. Upon arrival we got free breakfast vouchers and ice cream. was not too happy about required valet service at 30 a day so we parked in a nearby economy lot. A few things went wrong on this trip. Valet took forever to bring us a wine key to borrow. They said we had to return it after use. The AC unit would work intermittently we had to call for help. The phone is so old and needed updating. The 2nd night the smoke detector alarm started beeping from 5 am until we checked out. I called front desk and they asked me if we could take care of the problem. That is so inappropriate. She said her maintenance guy is not available until 7 am but maybe the valet guy can take care of it. No one arrived for 40mins. I had to call again. She said the valet does not know how to so it so they called the maintence guy to see his ETA. We should have been notified of this updateThe maintenance guy finally arrived and detached the alarm from the wall said he had be back later to replace it. After he left we realized he did not do anything because the alarm because he did not take it with him. It was still beeping. So I called again. And told them I put the alarm outside our room for them to take care of later. Anyways I told her to help compensate us for the inconveniences. She said ask the 3rd party booking company to help us. She did provide no extra 15 a day convenience free and breakfast vouchers. This last day was just awful we went able to relax.

Rea location but needs an overhaul. Great waterfront location willing staff but this place needs a serious overhaul. Second stay here for me. Booked a King waterfront room. View was great. Carpet filthy furniture and decor old and stale. Access to power was good in 195. Not adequate for todays needs. Old TVNo waste basket in the room had to find the one in the bathroom. Limited amenitiesInternet OK. Gym is old and not adequate for a hotel that bills itself as an A property Hotel system was down on check in and stayed down for some hours after.

Good. The location is really lovely and my room was are large. Other than that I can not say much else e about the hotel. As I mentioned below the staff was very nice but very poorly informed. It felt as if the entire staff was new minus one women and that none of them had ever worked in service before. The hotel was fine but I have never stayed in a hotel where the staff knew so little. Every question I asked whether it was how much is an average Uber ride to the airport or is there a convenience store nearby. Was met with a blank stare and an I do not know. When I asked how I get a shuttle back to the hotel that night I was told by the bellman to just call the hotel. When I asked for a card with the number on it he stared at me blankly and then ruffled through a drawer and then told me he did not have one. When I went to the front desk and asked for the same thing I was met with the same response until the manager came out and direct the young lady what to do. When I was not informed that the shuttle did not run on Saturdays after discussing with them that I would need a shuttle I was directed to an obscure sign on the wall. When I brought it up with the front desk mentioning that I now had no way to get to my location she turned the other way offer no help or solutions. I even asked the time from a maintenance person and he stared at me blankly maybe he did not speak English. I am uncertain. I do have to say they are all very nice just really uninformed. I felt like I was in some sort of hotel twilight zone. Also there are no services at the hotel so in the am there is coffee served but no tea. In the room it is the same coffee only. There is a cafe attached to the hotel but when I went there I paid close to 6 for tea.

I felt like I was in some sort of hotel twilight zone. Also there are no services at the hotel so in the am there is coffee served but no tea. In the room it is the same coffee only. There is a cafe attached to the hotel but when I went there I paid close to 6 for tea.

seems boutique but kinda impersonal. The stay was fine. the location was close to an event location so things were convenient. There were just 2 moments where i felt like i was just a transaction. Upon check in i asked if i could get a late check out in the morning. I was told i could. but it would cost 75bux. I declined the offer. It felt like a cash grab. I remember better times in hospitality where you could get service without a price. Where a late check out would cost a smile and a good attitude. The next day after check out i spend the day touring SFO leaving my bags with the porter. I came back to get my bags order a taxi for the airport and charge up my phone. I asked to use the bathroom and was made to feel this was a reach even though i had stayed the night before. So generally the things you expect would be available as a guest in any hotel felt like they were available to the wealthy or were a bit of an imposition.

Exceptional. Wonderful location. The staff was polite and helpful. We booked a standard queen room and ended up receiving a room with a large patio balcony overlooking the water. You could even see all the way across to San Francisco. I enjoyed seeing all the yachts in the marina and all the bustle of Jack London square. The only thing I can complain about is the loud excessive horn blowing of the train coming through in the morning. It was exciting to see the train all day long but at 6 AM it was a bit much.

Booked a suite for the night of my wedding and room was n’t ready at check in even though we messaged the property beforehand that we were coming in one hour early. This would ’ve been understandable except the staff was NOT empathetic AT ALL. We were downgraded to a junior suite because it was the only thing available and we were on a tight timeline. No price adjustments offered even though we paid for a larger room and stayed in a smaller one. I understand that we were a little early but if that was a problem 1 the property should ’ve told us as we mentioned this months ago and 2. at least act like you care it ’s my freaking wedding night. Room itself was bare. Phones did n’t work. We had to use our cell phones to call the public general number to get to front desk. When you walk across the room the dresses and tv shakes. Do yourself a favor and stay at the Mariot instead.
Adequate rooms lobby. Some rooms have wonderful views of the bay estuary. Several meeting rooms usually filled with corporate trainings.

If you are working in the area this is the best option. The beds are okay but not super comfy the linens were clean and everything was stocked. The pool is in the main building so not very safe if you are alone to do a morning swim. The gym is in the building with the rooms though.

If you are working in the area this is the best option. The beds are okay but not super comfy the linens were clean and everything was stocked. The pool is in the main building so not very safe if you are alone to do a morning swim. The gym is in the building with the rooms though.
Good. Staff at the desk. Awesome. You can not park anywhere for free and you have to pay them 32 day to park. No choice.

I had a hard time sleeping in this pretty comfortable friendly hotel but enjoyed it anyway. Waterfront is a cute hotel with a waterfront location at Jack London Square convenient to many great spots in Oakland. It is clean cozy and comfortable with a happy hour and friendly staff members who create a warm atmosphere. The morning after my first night I was woken up by housekeepers talking and laughing loudly in the hall early one day. On my second morning at 9 am on a Sunday after having been out late the night before I was startled awake by a house keeper knocking rapidly three times and then pushing the door open before waiting for a response while I was still in bed. In addition the hotel is located very near working train tracks so I was also kept awake at night by train whistles. That was part of the charm but next time will bring earplugs. My room did technically have a balcony which I was grateful for but it faced mostly other walls so the room was dark and the balcony uninviting. Finally the only parking available cost 32 a night which seemed excessive on top of the price of the hotel stay.

Exceptional. I liked when I called front desk to ask if valet was going to be charged on my card. because I had lost it. The girl at the front desk said not to worry about it that she wo nt charged me valet. That made my day. I did nt like the balcony setting up on second floor. they should remodel that. Not a good look.

My handicapped mom stayed here when visiting me. It felt like a previously nice hotel on its way down or a lower tier hotel on its way up. Some touchpoints were nice Jonathan Adler bathroom products. and some were weird a living room area in the suite that felt empty and underconsidered all light switches on the hinge side of doors etc. Location and view is great but the worst part for us was the fact that to get to my moms handicapped room from the front desk or drop off point before the valet she had to walk to the next building over as none of the handicapped rooms can be accessed from the front door. For her that is very scary feeling isolated from help if needed. Plus every time we came with the car to drop her off or pick her up we had to explain the need to drive through the valet parking to the valets. They were friendly but it was definitely a hassle and felt like a system not designed with handicapped customers in mind. Also to avoid paying the 20 day valet just to visit my mom for an hour I parked a couple blocks away and my car was broken into.

I arrived at about 4 pm. The front desk staff person was really not welcoming. Rather harsh in the manner in which she greeted. I later went downstairs to ask a question about dining and the fitness center. She was very fast in response and was also abrasive. Later the waitress at the restaurant was also abrasive. When I walked into the restaurant which was virtually empty at about 530she looked at me with a harsh tone and said Can I help you. instead of something like One for dinner. or Can I seat you for dinner. It was very odd. I understand that working in this industry can be challenging as the public can be rather rude. However I am a friendly person. I smile when I enter into these spaces. I was really taken aback by the service. Maybe they were having an off day.

I arrived at about 4 pm. The front desk staff person was really not welcoming. Rather harsh in the manner in which she greeted. I later went downstairs to ask a question about dining and the fitness center. She was very fast in response and was also abrasive. Later the waitress at the restaurant was also abrasive. When I walked into the restaurant which was virtually empty at about 530she looked at me with a harsh tone and said Can I help you. instead of something like One for dinner. or Can I seat you for dinner. It was very odd. I understand that working in this industry can be challenging as the public can be rather rude. However I am a friendly person. I smile when I enter into these spaces. I was really taken aback by the service. Maybe they were having an off day.

New Years 2020 Getaway. We arrived too early and planned to leave our luggage and take the ferry to SF. it was no problem for us we did not want to rush the housekeeping staff. As we were walking out to get the ferry one of the front desk staff let us know about a room that was avaialble that ended being nicer than the one we booked. They were all so friendly and acomadating. we will be back.

Quaint hotel on the water front. Front desk staff was excellent with one exception. I did like the text message welcome helped me confirm two nights in the same room with different billing. Billing issues. And database issues that caused a delay in getting in my room the second night. Broken front door made the lobby area very cold.
We have stayed at the Waterfront several times in the past 3 years. We love staying there. The rooms are clean and comfortable the staff is helpful and friendly and the location is the best.

The hotels is everything we hoped. Beautiful. Nice helpful staff. Nice surroundings. The only thing I wish I would have been aware of is the train. There is a train that runs by and honks it is horn when it passes around 8 am. I was planning to sleep in. But could not after the train woke me upnim buying earplugs for tonight. The hotel itself is great.
